column2: [Fernflower] Support Asserts that have the throw in the else clause instead of the if clause

column3: As the title says: the throw new AssertionError() of a compiled assertion can be in the if or the else clause. Currently Fernflower only deals with the case where it is in the if clause.
In this example the method foo(Object x) is the problem, the assertion in it decompiles to: if($assertionsDisabled || ... with the throw in the else clause.

The example is part of this pull request: #390
It is deactivated in that pull by default because it fails without this fix.
